content.description: After a bouldery start you will find a few nice finger pockets and some nice ledges. Avoiding the moss, move past a couple of bulges staying to the right towards to arete.  The crux is about 3/4 the way up as you move past a football size boulder that is a major key hold.
content.protection: Top rope only, use webbing and sling some stuff at the top.  Some directionals may be required to safely stick to the arete. Flipping your rope around a boulder near the top may help protect the start.
content.location: This is the far right climb on The Hostess. Start near the base of a large tree staying to the right all the way up.

content.description: This climb starts off on some steep jugs with a few high step moves and then mellows out on some easy slab.  After a couple of low angle slab moves the features disappear and the climb steepens. After the steep crux, finish on a nice jugy arete over the top.
content.protection: This is a top rope climb that requires some webbing to set up a rope.
content.location: This is the center route on The Hostess just left of the arete.

content.description: On top of the Hostess Formation and to the left are two top-rope anchor bolts for setting up this route. Bit of dirt near the bottom, but lately it's been cleaning up more.
